title: why does kallistas rend have a slow?
body:
serious question. the ability was clearly designed as an execute. after she auto attacked and lodged as many spears as possible into her target, she hits him with a large nuke to finish the champion off.

so why does it need a slow? i know kallista is technically not op, just utterly anoying to play against.

other execute abilites dont have cc attached, in case the player miscalculates. and if you expect rend to finish your target off, a slow doesnt really make sense. so why is it there? wouldnt that be a possibility to remove uneccessary power from her kit, put it somewhere else and make her a little bit less frustrating to deal with?

her kit is already focused on contineous kiting with her jumps, and an extra jump on her q. the slow should really not be necessary. it just feels like its attached onto the ability because reasons, and only serves to make her more frustrating to fight.

replies.body: Personally I think they put it there simply for the perspective that you are getting a bunch of spears violently ripped out of you, you aren't going to be moving to fast after that.

I believe CertainlyT put the slow on there to create tension over the decision of when to push Rend.  It asks Kalista players, "Do you rend now for the guaranteed utility or do you hold onto it for future Tons-of-Damage.tm but risk your target escaping or catching you/an ally?"

Really is that the reason to add a slow to a perma-kite-all-melee champ? That seems to me very poor reasoning. She would still be where she is today even without the slow. If I were to want to add utility to her kit it would have been adding vision of target or preventing stealth while impaled, not adding CC to a perma kite kit.

I've been asking that question since her kit was revealed.

Kalista was created to give new players a champion that would:
1. Encourage team interaction and be fun
2. Teach orb walking and be fun

I think she has been a success and she really adds a lot to League.  Most people overrate her frustrating nature, it's really not that bad.  Vayne can be just as annoying, not only can she roll constantly, but she can go invisible and blast you backwards.  LeBlanc is way more oppressive and snowballs much more easily.  I could go on, but I won't.  There are multiple ways to lock Kali down and she's fun to play with.  Her Sentinels are cool, she's fun to watch and if you are her soul-bound, then you have a get-out-of-jail-free card basically every minute or so.  What's not to like?

*You* are reading the ability wrong. The first spear does the most damage, and if you hold it you don't get to use the slow.

The optimal use case is:

~~AA, Rend, AA until Rend is off CD, Rend. Repeat.~~
See Nine Ravens response.

You don't stack the Rend passive when it's on cooldown, so using it immediately every time it's off cooldown is actually terrible damage-wise. However since the CD refreshes on getting a kill with it, the optimal damage case is to use it every time it will kill something, i.e. as an execute. There are basically three cases to best use Rend:
1) To kill something, maximizing DPS
2) At the end of an engagement/trade to put max damage on enemies in a case where you can't kill them
3) When you need the utility of the slow more than you need to maximize damage from the skill
